page.title: 10Smarden - Transport
page.content: A shortage of public transport for people without cars or motor-cycles causes real problems, especially in emergencies or for young people getting to work or college. Bicycles are sometimes used for transport but more often for leisure. Two buses a.m. and one p.m. go to Ashford daily, a private bus to Maidstone on Tuesdays and to Canterbury on Wednesdays. Private car owners run a service to Headcorn on Thursdays for shopping. The main railway line runs through the area but the nearest stations are at Headcorn and Pluckley, both about 3 miles from the village centre. Transport of goods in over-large vehicles trying to pass through the village caused much concern, one corner house being damaged almost weekly until very heavy lorries were prohibited.
